casebody.data:
The State of Ohio, Appellee, v. Smith, Appellant.

[Cite as State v. Smith (1999), 84 Ohio St.3d 1241.]

(No. 97-2730 Submitted October 28, 1998 Decided February 10, 1999.) John F. Holcomb, Butler County Prosecuting Attorney, Daniel G. Eichel and Richard A. Hyde, Assistant Prosecuting Attorneys, for appellee. David H. Bodiker, Ohio Public Defender, and Lori J. Rankin, Assistant State Public Defender, for appellant. Keith A. Yeazel, urging reversal for amicus curiae, Ohio Association of Criminal Defense Lawyers. William Mason, Cuyahoga County Prosecuting Attorney, and Erika Ritt, Assistant Prosecuting Attorney, urging affirmance for amicus curiae, Cuyahoga County Prosecutor’s Office.

The cause is dismissed for want of a conflict within the meaning of S.Ct.Prac.R. IV(2)(B).

Moyer, C.J., Douglas, Resnick, F.E. Sweeney, Pfeifer, Cook and Lundberg Stratton, JJ., concur.
